Notes.Text:
This update fixes two heap-based buffer overflows in tidy/libtidy. These vulnerabilities
could allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via vectors involving
a command character in an href. (CVE-2015-5522, CVE-2015-5523)
Notes.Title: Details

Vulnerabilities.Description: Heap-based buffer overflow in the ParseValue function in lexer.c in tidy before 4.9.31 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via vectors involving a command character in an href.

Vulnerabilities.Description: The ParseValue function in lexer.c in tidy before 4.9.31 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via vectors involving multiple whitespace characters before an empty href, which triggers a large memory allocation.
